functionalj.pipeable

Class Catch<OUTPUT,FINALOUTPUT,EXCEPTION extends Exception>

  • java.lang.Object
    • functionalj.pipeable.Catch<OUTPUT,FINALOUTPUT,EXCEPTION>
  • Type Parameters:
    OUTPUT - the output from the step before.
    FINALOUTPUT - the output from this last step.
    EXCEPTION - the exception this last step might throw.

    public abstract class Catch<OUTPUT,FINALOUTPUT,EXCEPTION extends Exception>
extends Object
    Classes extending this class handle the last step in the processing of the Pipeable. NOTE: This class was initially written as a functional interface. However, it causes ambiguity with other functions.
    Author:
    NawaMan -- nawa@nawaman.net

        public abstract FINALOUTPUT doCatch(OUTPUT data,
                                    Exception exception)
                             throws EXCEPTION extends Exception
        Performs the output and catch the exception if any.
        Parameters:
        data - the output data.
        exception - the exception that occurs over the pipe.
        Returns:
        the final output.
        Throws:
        EXCEPTION - the exception that might be thrown from this method.
        EXCEPTION extends Exception

      • thenThrowRuntimeException

        public static <OUTPUT> Catch<OUTPUT,OUTPUT,RuntimeException> thenThrowRuntimeException()
        Returns the catch that will throw a runtime exception if any. If the exception is not a runtime exception, it will be wrapped with FunctionInvocationException.
        Type Parameters:
        OUTPUT - the output data type.
        Returns:
        the catch.
